property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: A section of the CORE split into a 3x3 grid. The protagonist must nagivate this area in order to unlock the way to The End.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist witnesses two black sausage NPCs retreating into the CORE. [[Alphys]] tells them that monsters are not supposed to inhabit the CORE.

property.name: description
property.value: An elevator that leads to the end of the CORE. It is initially non-functional, only usable after reaching the other side. On the [[Genocide Route]], this elevator is functional, allowing the protagonist to bypass the rest of the CORE.

property.name: description
property.value: An elevator leading to the lobby of the CORE.

property.name: description
property.value: Pressing this switch deactivates the force field but sends a group of lasers in the following order: ''blue'', ''blue'', ''orange''.

property.name: description
property.value: After evaluating [[Mettaton]]'s situation following his defeat, [[Alphys]] follows the protagonist as they make their way to the elevator.

property.name: description
property.value: The elevator to New Home. After opening this elevator, [[Alphys]] reveals to the protagonist that they must kill [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]] in order to return home.

property.name: page
property.value: New Home

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must solve a shooting puzzle to unlock the way to The End. They are given two rounds of ammunition for the puzzle. It can be solved by entering ''down'', ''left'', ''down'', ''left'', ''down'', ''left'', ''up'', ''right''.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must clear either the Warrior's Path or the Sage's path to deactivate this force field. Alternatively, they can wait in front of it for a while, and it will disappear automatically.

property.name: description
property.value: ''The air is filled with the smell of ozone... it fills you with determination.''

properties.property: Behind this door must be the elevator to the [[Asgore Dreemurr|King]]'s castle. You're filled with determination.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and directs them to the elevator. The protagonist can either check the elevator or enter one of the other rooms.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and notes that the elevator is out of order. She then directs the protagonist to the left or right room depending on where they went first.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and notes the flaming pit, which is not on her map.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and warns them of a monster ambush. After the battle, she wonders why so many monster are present in the CORE.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and explains that they cannot progress unless they press the switch, which sends a group of lasers in a specific order. Alphys says the order is ''orange'', ''orange'', ''blue''.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and notes that she stated the incorrect order of the lasers.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and directs them to the eastern path.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist. She changes her mind and directs them to the north.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist after the monster ambush and asks if they are okay.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and attempts to deactivate the lasers blocking the way. After failing to do so, she cuts off power for the entire room.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and tells them to stop moving. As she says that, the power suddenly turns back on. Alphys is unable to keep the power off, so she instructs the protagonist to only keep moving while the power is off and stop once it turns back on.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and expresses relief that everything appears to be under control.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and is completely at a loss for how to guide them at this point, so she leaves them alone.

property.name: description
property.value: On the [[True Pacifist Route]], [[Undyne]] calls the protagonist and asks them to deliver [[Undyne's Letter|a letter]] for her.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. Says that they used to make a game out of locating the flaming pit since the CORE is always rearranging.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. Explains that they were hired by [[Mettaton]] to kill the protagonist but quit since they were never paid.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. They appear to be asleep.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. Reveals that the CORE was rearranged in anticipation of the protagonist specifically.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. Explains why they look like a "black sausage" instead of any discernible shape.

property.name: description
property.value: ''North, the warrior's path. West, the sage's path. Any path leads to The End.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''East... The End.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Solve this puzzle, and The End will open.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Why not relax and have a nice snack?''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Get lost... And stay that way.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Traverse the northern room, and The End will open.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''To the East! This is The End.''

properties.property: I cannot fight. I cannot think. But, with patience, I will make my way through.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can pick up a Glamburger from inside this trash can.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can pick up 100 [[GOLD]] from inside this trash can.

property.name: description
property.value: Scripted encounter against a Madjick on the [[Neutral Route]].

property.name: description
property.value: Scripted encounter against a Knight Knight.

property.name: page
property.value: Knight Knight

property.name: description
property.value: Part 1 of the Warrior's Path, consisting of an encounter against [[Whimsalot]] and [[Final Froggit]].

property.name: description
property.value: Part 2 of the Warrior's Path, consisting of an encounter against [[Knight Knight]] and [[Madjick]].

property.name: description
property.value: Part 3 of the Warrior's Path, consisting of an encounter against [[Final Froggit]], [[Astigmatism]], and [[Whimsalot]].

property.name: description
property.value: [[Mettaton]] reveals his true intentions to the protagonist and attacks. On the [[Neutral Route]], the protagonist can trick him into turning around and exposing the switch on his backside, transforming him into [[Mettaton EX]]. On the [[Genocide Route]], Mettaton transforms into [[Mettaton NEO]], who is killed in a single strike.
